intro: Moehringia grisebachii, commonly known as the gray moehringia, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a silvery-gray underside, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Moehringia grisebachii is often found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
